title: Polynomial Long Division: Step-by-Step Guide
topic_summary: A clear, step-by-step tutorial on performing long division for polynomials, using the example (x³ + 3x² + x - 3) ÷ (x + 1), aimed at building confidence in algebraic manipulation.
target_audience: High school and early college algebra students

scenes.title: Introduction to Polynomial Division
scenes.narration_summary: Hook the viewer, explain why polynomial division is useful beyond calculator use, introduce dividend and divisor concepts.

scenes.title: Example Setup
scenes.narration_summary: Present the specific example polynomials and set up the division structure.

scenes.title: Step 1: First Division
scenes.narration_summary: Divide leading terms, multiply across, subtract to get first partial remainder.

scenes.title: Step 2: Bring Down and Repeat
scenes.narration_summary: Bring down next term, repeat division/multiply/subtract process.

scenes.title: Step 3: Final Division
scenes.narration_summary: Complete the division, reveal quotient and remainder, verify by multiplication.

scenes.title: Recap and Key Takeaways
scenes.narration_summary: Summarize the step-by-step process, highlight common pitfalls, encourage practice.
